text:
Not sure how to decipher all this, but
```julia> @Meta.lower a, b = x
:($(Expr(:thunk, CodeInfo(
    @ none within `top-level scope'
1 ─ %1 = Base.indexed_iterate(x, 1)
│   %2 = Core.getfield(%1, 1)
│        a = %2
│        #s73 = Core.getfield(%1, 2)
│   %5 = Base.indexed_iterate(x, 2, #s73)
│   %6 = Core.getfield(%5, 1)
│        b = %6
└──      return x
))))```

│   %5 = Base.indexed_iterate(x, 2, #s73)

text: yeah, I tried that too. i was hoping `@edit u,v = U` would show what gets called, but it didn’t work

text: `@edit` does something different, what `lower` shows you does not exist anywhere as a piece of Julia code.  `@edit` can only point you to the source code of something you're calling. As you already know, `=` is not a function call
